comments:
I had attempted to watch an inherited private field (results in error in 
evaluation).
I had then watched some other fields and inspected a HashMap instance variable.

So in the Expressions view I had:
<<Inspect result>>this.entrySet()
<<Failed Watch>>fTitleImage
<<Watch>> page
<<Failed Watch>>fWritableLabel

If you select the first item, then second then third in the details pane:
[]
<unknown>
null
If you select the second then third in the details pane you get no details.

Appears if you select an error node first as part of a multi-select nothing is 
shown in the details pane.

With the new watch expression implementation, watch expressions now report 
errors which are then displayed under the expression in the tree.

Do we want to do the same thing for IExpressions? I've coded up an 
implementation by adding a new interface that between IExpression and 
IWatchExpression that extends IExpression and pushes the error reporting API up 
from the new IWatchExpression interface.

I can release the code if we want this.

As long as an IExpression does not have to implement the "error" stuff we are 
OK (i.e. non-breaking API change such that existing IExpression implementations 
do not break).

Latest plugins
Breakpoint on line 87 of AntEditor
At breakpoint, in the variables view attempted to watch the 
variable "configElement"
<<note no switch to the Expressions view?>>
Switched to expressions view
Failed watch there with error message
Back in the variables view, inspected "class$0"
